item.title: About
item.description:
My first job after finishing my MSc. was writing training material about an open-source framework used by several organisations. I never thought myself as a gifted writer and I certainly preferred writing code than documentation. Despite this, I felt a certain sense of clarity while drawing diagrams for the powerpoint slides and writing the accompanying training docs. A kind of clarity which I could not get by reading books or sitting at classes. I guess the act of writing forced me to get my facts rights and

Long story short, I decided to created this blog to

This clarity gave me more confidence to speak up in technical discussions and be more artcil..

helped be more articulate with colleageus in our technical discussions

Something I felt as well, is that I could articulate my thoughts better with my colleagues….

Programmer, engineer, architect. Pick one. Titles are irrelevant to me.

My craft is writing software which I have been doing for over a decade. This blog was created as way to share my thoughts with the rest of the community.

I am an independent software contractor living in the island of Malta. My trade is developing software and I have been doing that for over a decade.

My trade is developing software and I have been doing that for over a decade. During this period, I worked with front-end (e.g., HTML, CSS3, jQuery), backend (e.g., Spring MVC, Ruby on Rails, Grails, Hibernate), integration (e.g., Mule, JMS, ZeroMQ) as well as mobile (e.g., Android, Apache Cordova) technologies.

My idols in the software industry are Martin Fowler, Dan North, and Fred George.

Although I consider myself to be a jack of all trades, my speciality lies in enterprise integration. I have offered consultancy to several companies on how to go about integrating their systems. High-profile clients include MuleSoft, QVC Italy, Rabobank, MoneySupermarket.com and DealerTrack Technologies.

When I am not offering consultancy, I blog about open source software, create pet projects, dabble with the latest technologies, or dance tango ;-).
